column3: Go to the admin applications search page at /admin/admin_site_search

column4: An message appears saying: You need to select an option in the "Journals vs. Articles facet" to use this option

column3: Restrict search journals to smaller number (eg. choose only "Subject" -> "Technology" and "Country"-> "Spain")
From the "Journals vs. Articles" assets on the left choose Journals
Choose the ISSN of one journal and enter it as a search term

column4: You should have only one journal as your search result

column3: From Bulk Edit Records "Select action..." pull down choose "Delete records ..."

column4: Warning message appears asking if you sure and shows you OK and Cancel button
Warning message appears showing the number of journals and articles affected
Message appears showing number of journals and articles queued for edit.
A link to the background job is available

column3: Click on the link provided to see the background job that was created

column4: The journal_bulk_delete background job is created
journal_bulk_delete shows the the correct number of journal IDs you deleted. (Should be one if you followed the steps above). selection_query shows the ISSN of the journal.

column3: Click dismiss on the message banner
